docs.snippet: After nine years and 2,810 posts, a blog seeking a sustainable path for humans on a finite planet comes to an end.

headline.main: After Nine Years and 2,810 Posts, a Dot Earth Farewell

docs.abstract: After nine years and 2,810 posts, a blog seeking a sustainable path for humans on a finite planet comes to an end.

docs.snippet: A North Carolina high school teacher says he has been placed on leave after students say he stepped on an American flag as part of a history lesson.

headline.print_headline: North Carolina Teacher Suspended for Stomping on US Flag
headline.main: North Carolina Teacher Suspended for Stomping on US Flag

docs.snippet: Twitter Inc on Tuesday stepped up its battle to attract video talent to its platform, saying it will allow U.S. users who upload a video to share in any advertising revenue it generates.

headline.print_headline: Twitter to Share Ad Revenue on Videos by U.S. Users
headline.main: Twitter to Share Ad Revenue on Videos by U.S. Users

docs.snippet: With the Geometric Intelligence deal, Uber wants to make major advances in how the computers behind self-driving vehicles think and make decisions on the road.

headline.print_headline: Uber Debuts Lab to Make Self-Driving Cars Smarter
headline.main: Uber Bets on Artificial Intelligence With Acquisition and New Lab

docs.abstract: Uber acquires artificial intelligence startup Geometric Intelligence for undisclosed terms; start-up's employees Gary Marcus and Zoubin Ghahramani will co-direct Uber AI Labs, ride-hailing company's in-house research arm for self-driving cars.

docs.snippet: Haiti’s first-ever LGBT film festival has been postponed after threats to burn down a building it was to be held in and an order by Port-au-Prince police to ban it, organizers said.

headline.print_headline: Haiti's First LGBT Film Festival Postponed After Threats, Police Ban
headline.main: Haiti's First LGBT Film Festival Postponed After Threats, Police Ban

docs.snippet: Twan — an 18-inch-long, roughly 10-pound blue-eyed doll with an alert expression — has appeared in five Broadway shows, including “Cinderella.”

headline.print_headline: He’s Short and Phony, but Finds Steady Work on Broadway
headline.main: That Broadway Baby, Now in ‘In Transit’

docs.snippet: A gold wedding ring lost over 37 years ago has been returned to its owner after a scuba diver found it in the waters off the eastern coastal city of Benidorm last month and began a social media search.

headline.print_headline: Man Gets Wedding Ring Back, 37 Years After Losing It in Sea
headline.main: Man Gets Wedding Ring Back, 37 Years After Losing It in Sea

docs.snippet: A wider variety of news sources was supposed to be the bulwark of a rational age. Instead, we are roiled by biases, gorging on what confirms our ideas and shunning what does not.

headline.print_headline: As Internet Seizes News, Grip on Truth Loosens
headline.main: How the Internet Is Loosening Our Grip on the Truth

docs.snippet: A young black bear led police on a two-hour chase through the streets of downtown Anchorage, Alaska — scurrying down sidewalks and across lanes of traffic and even ducking behind a Pizza Hut along the way.

headline.print_headline: Out of the Wild: Police Chase Bear Through Alaska City
headline.main: Out of the Wild: Police Chase Bear Through Alaska City

docs.snippet: This intense series about a group of teenagers has been a success across multiple platforms. Now there are plans for an English-language version.
docs.abstract: English-language version of hit Norwegian web and television series Skam will be produced by XIX Entertainment for American and Canadian audiences under title Shame; series is notable for telling intimate stories from teenagers' point of view and for its innovative use of social media.
